ETYMOLOGY: From Old French 'sauce', from Latin 'salsa' ('salted'), feminine of 'salsus' ('salted'), past participle of 'salere' ('to salt'), from 'sal' ('salt').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun - A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A thick liquid served with food to add moistness, flavor, or as a garnish.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 与食物一起食用的一种浓稠液体，用于增加湿润度、风味或作为装饰。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She poured a rich cheese sauce over the pasta.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她把浓郁的奶酪酱浇在意大利面上。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun - A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Impudent or impertinent talk or behavior; cheekiness.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 无礼或不敬的言谈举止；厚颜无耻。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Don't you dare give me any sauce, young man!

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: transitive verb - A verb that requires a direct object to complete its meaning.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To add sauce to food; to dress food with sauce.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 给食物加酱汁；用酱汁调味食物。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He sauced the chicken before grilling it.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他在烤鸡之前给鸡肉涂上了酱汁。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: transitive verb - A verb that requires a direct object to complete its meaning.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To treat (someone) with impudence or disrespect; to talk back to.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 无礼地或不敬地对待（某人）；顶嘴。
